Authors:
Nimali Indeewari de Silva, Sajeewa S.N. Maharachchikumbura,
D J Bhat, Abdullah Mohammed Al-Sadi, Saisamorn Lumyong, Kevin Hyde
Title: Monochaetia sinensis sp. nov. from Yunnan Province
Keywords:
molecular phylogeny, morphology, novel taxon,
Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
This work embodies a description of a novel Monochaetia
species, from a dead leaf of a Quercus species collected from Lijiang in
Yunnan Province, China. Morphologically, it conforms with the characters
of Monochaetia by the presence of a single apical and basal appendage on
the conidia. Considering phenotypic measurements of conidia, such as
length of apical and basal appendages, conidiogenous cells and molecular
phylogeny of partial large subunit rRNA (LSU), internal transcribed
spacers (ITS) and Î²-tubulin (TUB2), our taxon is distinguished from
other Monochaetia species.
